intro: Hibbertia lepidota, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in spring and summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Hibbertia lepidota is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
